definitions.definition: happening or existing before something else or before a particular time

examples.text: Although not essential, some **prior knowledge** of statistics is desirable.
This information must not be disclosed without **prior written consent**.
Please give us **prior notice** if you need an evening meal.
She will be unable to attend because of a **prior engagement**.

definitions.definition: already existing and therefore more important

examples.text: They have a **prior claim** to the property.
during the week prior to the meeting

wordOrigin: adjective early 18th cent.: from Latin, literally ‘former, elder’, related to prae ‘before’.
